MAIN.HEAD: 健康追踪的简单性
MAIN.SUBHEAD: 使日常任务变得敏捷而轻松的应用程序
MAIN.IMG: Apple Watch 健康与健康应用

ELECTROLYTE.HEAD: Electrolyte
ELECTROLYTE.ICO: Apple Watch 最简单的免费电解质消耗追踪器图标。密切关注镁、钙、钾、铁的摄入量。与苹果健康相连。零广告。
ELECTROLYTE.TEXT: 电解质在维持体内稳态方面起着至关重要的作用。 它们有助于调节心脏和神经功能，体液平衡，氧气输送，酸碱平衡等。
ELECTROLYTE.IMG: 使用 Apple Watch 记录电解质和矿物质
ELECTROLYTE.DWN: 从 Apple AppStore 下载免费的电解质跟踪器应用程序
ELECTROLYTE.ABOUT: 电解质在维持体内稳态方面起着至关重要的作用。 它们有助于调节心脏和神经功能，体液平衡，氧气输送，酸碱平衡等。 使用Apple Watch应用程序跟踪电解质的摄入量。
ELECTROLYTE.DESC1: 调节心律，神经功能，肌肉收缩，血压和糖水平，参与蛋白质，骨骼和DNA的制造。 镁缺乏会导致食欲不振，恶心，呕吐，疲劳和虚弱; 高水平可能会导致高镁血症。
ELECTROLYTE.DESC2: 帮助肌肉运动和神经在大脑和身体各个部位之间传递信息。 协助血管将血液输送到全身。 参与影响人体几乎所有功能的激素和酶的释放。 人体大约99％的钙供应存储在骨骼和牙齿中。
ELECTROLYTE.DESC3: 用于几乎所有的身体，包括正常的肾脏和心脏功能，肌肉收缩和神经传递。 钾缺乏会增加血压并消耗骨骼中的钙。
ELECTROLYTE.DESC4: 血红蛋白和肌红蛋白的重要组成部分是将氧气携带到身体组织和肌肉的蛋白质。 红细胞含有人体铁的一半以上。
ELECTROLYTE.DESC5: 消耗过多或过多的电解质以及排出过多或过多的电解质会导致电解质失衡。

MASS.HEAD: 体重
MASS.ICO: 我们最先进的健康可穿戴应用程序的图标，可让您直接从手腕轻松输入体重。自动应用程序内日志提供了一种轻松查看趋势以及按月和按年的所有测量结果的方法。完全免费，无应用内购买，零广告。这是 Apple Watch 专用应用程序。不需要 iPhone 配套应用程序即可运行。
MASS.TEXT: 跟踪体重可以提高您的时间和锻炼效率。 它不仅会促使您做得更好，而且还会促使您成为自己的竞争者！
MASS.IMG: 将体重直接从Apple Watch节省到与苹果健康同步 Storage中
MASS.DWN: 从 Apple AppStore 下载免费的体重应用程序
MASS.ABOUT: 体重日记是提高锻炼效率和实现目标的动力的完美工具。 所有数据都会同步到 与苹果健康同步 并安全地存储在您的 iCloud 中。 一切都很简单，而且完全免费。 零广告，无应用内购买。
MASS.DESC1: 我们对自己的健康负有责任。 没有人能使我们减肥或选择健康食品。 我们必须自己决定。
MASS.DESC2: 记录我们的体重使其真实。 虽然听起来很奇怪； 它是真实的。 这是数据，记录的事实。 无论我们是否录制它们，它们都是真实的。
MASS.DESC3: 每天进行日志记录很重要，它可以使我们养成健康的习惯。 每次输入日志时，都会提醒我们对健康的承诺。 在这里和那里跳过一天，可以轻松跳过2天，然后跳过3天。 然后，在不知不觉中，您已经停下脚步，回到了以前的习惯。
MASS.DESC4_2: 具有百分比差异的过去记录的历史记录
MASS.DESC4_3: 所有手表尺寸，所有表盘小部件类型
MASS.DESC4_5: 无需 iPhone 即可使用
MASS.DESC4_7: 免费、零广告且无应用内购买

VITAMIN.HEAD: 维生素
VITAMIN.ICO: 适用于 Apple Watch、iPhone 和 iPad 的最佳维生素和矿物质追踪器应用程序图标。与 与苹果健康同步 无缝同步。零广告。
VITAMIN.TEXT: 跟踪必需的维生素有很多好处，从帮助解决食物不耐症到增加能量，避免情绪变化以及为您的日常节奏加油。
VITAMIN.IMG: 直接在手腕上追踪最基本的维生素
VITAMIN.DWN: 从 Apple App Store 下载免费的维生素和营养素追踪应用程序
VITAMIN.ABOUT_1: 你确定你从食物中获得了所有必需的维生素和矿物质吗？
VITAMIN.ABOUT_2: 维生素可帮助您跟踪他们的消费情况。使用我们的应用程序提高您的饮食质量并增强您的健康。
VITAMIN.FOOT: 这个应用程序鼓励我们吃得健康，并在我们的食物选择上获得更高的标准，这反过来又有助于我们的身心保持强壮和健康。
VITAMIN.DESC1: 数据通过 iCloud 和 与苹果健康同步 应用程序在设备之间同步。
VITAMIN.DESC2: 来自真实用户的反馈有助于使该应用程序方便且易于理解。
VITAMIN.HEAD3: 支持 与苹果健康同步 中提供的所有维生素和矿物质
VITAMIN.DESC3: 跟踪 13 种必需维生素和 14 种重要矿物质。
VITAMIN.DESC4: 完全私密。我们不会将您的数据存储或传输给第三方。数据仅存储在您的 Apple 服务中。
VITAMIN.DESC5: 您无需创建帐户即可使用此应用。
VITAMIN.HEAD6: 能够添加 20 个自定义元素。
VITAMIN.DESC6: 除了预设之外，您还可以添加最多 %{count_tries} 种定制药片和补充剂。 膳食补充剂部分会自动计算您获得的维生素和矿物质的数量并为您存储。 “药丸”部分允许您创建 与苹果健康同步 不支持的任何药丸
VITAMIN.HEAD7: 数据在您的所有设备之间同步
VITAMIN.DESC7: 该应用适用于 Apple Watch、iPhone、iPad 和 Mac M。
VITAMIN.DESC8_1: “VITAMIN”这个词来自拉丁文“VITA”，意思是“生命”，事实上，没有维生素我们的生活是不可能的。
VITAMIN.DESC8_2: 维生素和矿物质是必需的营养微量元素。它们不提供能量，但对正常的机体功能和健康支持至关重要。
VITAMIN.DESC8_3: 要获得各种维生素，您应该吃所有类别的产品：全谷物、水果和蔬菜、乳制品、“鱼-蛋-家禽-肉类”类别的产品、脂肪（坚果和种子）。
VITAMIN.DESC8_4: 使用我们的应用程序，您可以追踪以下维生素和矿物质：

VITAMIN_FAT.NAME: 脂溶性维生素
VITAMIN_FAT.DESC: 脂溶性，意味着身体不立即需要的任何量都会被吸收并储存在脂肪组织或肝脏中。

VITAMIN_WATER.NAME: 水溶性维生素
VITAMIN_WATER.DESC: 水溶性维生素是溶解在水中的基本营养物质，在我们的身体中发挥重要作用。与脂溶性维生素不同，它们不会储存在体内，因此我们需要定期消耗它们。

ELECTROLYTE.NAME: 电解质
ELECTROLYTE.DESC: 电解质是重要的矿物质，在维持正常的身体功能，如液体平衡、神经功能和肌肉收缩方面发挥着关键作用。饮食均衡有助于维持必要的电解质水平，以获得最佳健康。

VITAMIN_A.HEAD: A
VITAMIN_A.NAME: 视黄醇
VITAMIN_A.DESK: 对身体的免疫系统和生殖功能很重要。它是一种强抗氧化剂，可调节皮肤再生和毛发生长。
VITAMIN_A.FUNC: 抗氧化特性、眼睛健康、免疫和生殖功能。适应昏暗条件。白细胞的产生和活性。
VITAMIN_A.DEF_1: 眼睛的失常包括夜盲症
VITAMIN_A.DEF_2: 皮肤病，表现为皮肤干燥
VITAMIN_A.DEF_3: 慢性缺乏可能与肺部发育异常和呼吸系统疾病 比如说肺炎
VITAMIN_A.DEF_4: 感染的严重程度增加，尤其是在喉咙或腹部
VITAMIN_A.DEF_5: 这是严重麻疹的主要危险因素
VITAMIN_A.OVER_1: 皮肤: 皮肤干燥、还有变色、手指出现裂纹
VITAMIN_A.OVER_3: 恶心，呕吐，食欲不振，关节疼痛，体温暂时升高
VITAMIN_A.OVER_4: 长期过度使用可能导致高胆固醇水平和骨形成变化→有骨质流失的风险
VITAMIN_A.OVER_5: 可能会干扰维生素 D 的有益作用。
VITAMIN_A.FACT_1: 所有身体组织的生长包括皮肤和头发
VITAMIN_A.FACT_2: 身体可以根据需要从贝塔-胡萝卜素中形成维生素A
VITAMIN_A.FACT_3: 有人声称某些防晒霜、润肤霜和润唇膏中添加的维生素 A 会导致维生素 A 中毒或致癌
VITAMIN_A.FACT_4: 发生晚期年龄相关性黄斑变性的风险降低 18-25%（AREDS2 研究）

VITAMIN_D.HEAD: D
VITAMIN_D.NAME: 骨化醇
VITAMIN_D.DESK: 它支持牙齿、骨骼和肌肉的健康。缺乏这种维生素会导致儿童佝偻病和成人骨软化症。
VITAMIN_D.FUNC: 保持骨骼和牙齿健康。肠道吸收钙。减少炎症。调节免疫功能。肌肉纤维的生长。在葡萄糖代谢中发挥作用。
VITAMIN_D.OVER_1: 过量的维生素 D 是有毒的
VITAMIN_D.FACT_1: 帮助吸收 Ca（钙）和 P（磷）
VITAMIN_D.FACT_2: 身体可以制造维生素 D
VITAMIN_D.FACT_3: 高水平的身体脂肪会限制从皮肤获取维生素 D（BMI 为 30+）
VITAMIN_D.FACT_4: 临床试验：维生素 D 补充剂不能预防或治疗抑郁症状或轻度抑郁症
VITAMIN_D.FACT_5: 没有确凿证据表明 D 有助于预防多发性硬化症
VITAMIN_D.FACT_6: 维生素D不仅是一种维生素，也是一种激素。
VITAMIN_D.FACT_7: 大量的维生素 D 不会促进体重减轻

VITAMIN_E.HEAD: E
VITAMIN_E.NAME: 生育酚
VITAMIN_E.DESK: 它是一種強大的抗氧化劑，參與纖維的形成，使皮膚保持彈性。 對生殖系統有顯著影響。
VITAMIN_E.FUNC: 强大的抗氧化剂。参与免疫功能。扩张血管并防止血液在血管内凝结。调节基因表达和其他代谢过程。细胞利用维生素 E 相互作用并执行许多重要功能
VITAMIN_E.DEF_2: 神经损伤，通常在手或脚
VITAMIN_E.DEF_3: 失去对身体运动的控制
VITAMIN_E.DEF_5: 患有脂肪吸收不良症的人更容易变得缺乏
VITAMIN_E.OVER_1: 超过 1000 毫克的剂量会增加出血过多的风险
VITAMIN_E.FACT_1: 储存在脂肪组织和肝脏中
VITAMIN_E.FACT_2: 帮助身体吸收维生素K和A
VITAMIN_E.FACT_3: 服用 50 毫克维生素 E 的男性吸烟者患前列腺癌的几率降低 32%
VITAMIN_E.FACT_4: 服用 180 毫克维生素 E 5.5 年的健康男性患前列腺癌的风险增加 17%
VITAMIN_E.FACT_5: 科学家争论维生素 E 补充剂是否有害
VITAMIN_E.FACT_6: 一项针对 18,000 名女性的绝经后乳腺癌研究发现维生素 E 没有任何益处
VITAMIN_E.FACT_7: 一项针对 87,998 名女性的结肠癌研究发现维生素 E 没有益处
VITAMIN_E.FACT_8: 一项针对服用补充维生素 E 10 年或更长时间的成年人的研究降低了死于膀胱癌的风险
VITAMIN_E.FACT_9: 迄今为止的证据不足以支持服用维生素 E 来预防癌症
VITAMIN_E.FACT_10: 大量摄入维生素 E（20 毫克/天）可将患 AMD（年龄相关性黄斑变性——老年人严重视力丧失的最常见原因）的风险降低约 20%
VITAMIN_E.FACT_11: 一项为期 5 年的研究：通过每天服用含有维生素 E（180 毫克 dl-α-生育酚乙酸酯）、β-胡萝卜素（15 毫克）、维生素 C（500 毫克）的补充剂，患晚期 AMD 的风险降低了 25%， 与服用安慰剂的参与者相比，锌（80 毫克）和铜（2 毫克）
VITAMIN_E.FACT_12: 一项关于阿尔茨海默病进展和认知能力下降的研究发现维生素 E 没有任何好处
VITAMIN_E.FACT_13: 有助于提高精子活力和数量，降低因精子数量低和运动缓慢引起的男性不育的风险
VITAMIN_E.FACT_14: 它能调节月经周期，帮助受孕，促进健康怀孕

VITAMIN_K.HEAD: K
VITAMIN_K.NAME: 叶绿醌，甲萘醌
VITAMIN_K.DESK: 维生素有助于产生凝血和骨骼构建所需的特殊蛋白质。
VITAMIN_K.FUNC: 蛋白质的合成。参与凝血和骨代谢等多种生理功能。
VITAMIN_K.FACT_1: 抗生素会阻碍维生素 K 的代谢
VITAMIN_K.FACT_2: 因为维生素K是脂溶性的，所以最好吃含一些脂肪的维生素K食物，以促进吸收
VITAMIN_K.FACT_3: 维生素 K 通过胎盘的运输很差，增加了新生儿维生素 K 缺乏的风险
VITAMIN_K.FACT_4: 一项研究发现，连续 3 年每天服用 180 微克可提高骨骼强度并减少脊柱高度的损失
VITAMIN_K.FACT_5: 很难自然形成维生素 K 过量，因为合成维生素 K 的肠道细菌不会对宿主造成损害
VITAMIN_K.FACT_6: 甲萘醌（一种合成的水溶性维生素 K 前体）会导致中毒（婴儿会出现贫血和黄疸）。
VITAMIN_K.FACT_7: 如果母乳中缺乏维生素 K，新生儿就会因缺少产生维生素 K 的肠道细菌而缺乏维生素 K

VITAMIN_B1.HEAD: B1
VITAMIN_B1.NAME: 硫胺素
VITAMIN_B1.DESK: 維生素 B1 是能量代謝所必需的，對於乙醯膽鹼的合成也很重要，乙醯膽鹼負責傳導神經衝動和神經系統中的其他過程。
VITAMIN_B1.DEF_1: 周围神经和消瘦的问题
VITAMIN_B1.FACT_1: 精神压力的时候增强免疫系统
VITAMIN_B1.FACT_2: 单宁（茶和咖啡中发现的一种化学物质）会干扰 B1 的吸收。
VITAMIN_B1.FACT_3: 高温或长时间烹饪会破坏约 70% 的 B1
VITAMIN_B1.FACT_4: 体内 B1 过量的情况极为罕见
VITAMIN_B1.FACT_5: 人体通过尿液排出多余的 B1

VITAMIN_B2.HEAD: B2
VITAMIN_B2.NAME: 核黄素
VITAMIN_B2.DESK: B2 是红细胞和抗体形成所必需的。它对身体的生殖功能也很重要。抗氧化特性。 从脂肪和类固醇产生能量。 葡萄糖代谢。 细胞的生长和发育。 参与体内的氧化还原反应。对视觉具有重要意义。
VITAMIN_B2.FUNC: 抗氧化特性。从脂肪和类固醇中产生能量。在葡萄糖代谢中必不可少。细胞的生长和发育。
VITAMIN_B2.DEF_1: 嘴巴、嘴唇、舌头或喉咙肿胀。
VITAMIN_B2.OVER_1: 我们没有任何风险的证据
VITAMIN_B2.FACT_1: 可能对预防偏头痛有效（美国头痛学会
VITAMIN_B2.FACT_2: 肠道中的细菌可以产生少量它
VITAMIN_B2.FACT_3: 大多数核黄素会立即使用，只有少量会储存在肝脏、心脏和肾脏中
VITAMIN_B2.FACT_4: 帮助身体将维生素 B6 和 B9 转化为它可以使用的形式
VITAMIN_B2.FACT_5: 核黄素具有荧光黄的颜色 暴露在光线下会使它失活并使其无法使用
VITAMIN_B2.FACT_6: 保護眼睛免受陽光照射
VITAMIN_B2.FACT_7: 可防止眼睛水晶體混濁（白內障）

VITAMIN_B3.HEAD: B3
VITAMIN_B3.NAME: 烟酸
VITAMIN_B3.DESK: 它有助于神经和消化系统保持健康，让皮肤看起来很好。DNA保護。
VITAMIN_B3.FUNC: 从碳水化合物、脂肪和蛋白质中产生能量。抗氧化特性。胆固醇和脂肪酸的合成。DNA 的产生和修复。
VITAMIN_B3.DEF_1: 暴露在阳光下的皮肤上出现厚厚的鳞状色素性皮疹
VITAMIN_B3.DEF_4: 头痛、记忆力减退和疲劳
VITAMIN_B3.OVER_1: 30至50毫克——会导致面部、手臂和胸部的皮肤变成微红色
VITAMIN_B3.OVER_2: 1000毫克以上会导致高血压、疲劳、腹痛、糖耐量受损和胰岛素抵抗。请注意，即使服用非常高的剂量，烟酸也几乎完全被您的身体吸收。
VITAMIN_B3.FACT_1: 非常高剂量的烟酸——超过 RDA 的 100 倍——多年服用可能是治疗血脂异常的有效方法
VITAMIN_B3.FACT_2: 烟酸和铬一起服用可能会降低血糖

VITAMIN_B5.HEAD: B5
VITAMIN_B5.NAME: 泛酸
VITAMIN_B5.DESK: 泛酸参与脂肪、蛋白质和碳水化合物的分解和同化。
VITAMIN_B5.FUNC: 從碳水化合物、蛋白質和脂質產生能量。 維護健康的皮膚。 性激素和壓力相關激素的產生。
VITAMIN_B5.DEF_1: 几乎存在于所有食物中，-缺乏是罕见的
VITAMIN_B5.DEF_3: 小鼠实验显示皮肤刺激和白发病
VITAMIN_B5.OVER_3: 可能与生物素竞争肠道和细胞摄取
VITAMIN_B5.FACT_3: 可降低血液中的胆固醇和脂肪

VITAMIN_B6.HEAD: B6
VITAMIN_B6.NAME: 吡哆醇
VITAMIN_B6.DESK: 它调节蛋白质交换、铁代谢及其向骨髓细胞和其他组织的运输。
VITAMIN_B6.FUNC: 从碳水化合物、脂肪和蛋白质中产生能量。红细胞产生。保持细胞健康。免疫功能。大脑健康。神经递质（大脑中的化学信使）的产生。大脑对能量消耗的调节。
VITAMIN_B6.DEF_2: 神经损伤，通常在手或脚
VITAMIN_B6.DEF_5: 肥胖、酒精、雌激素或类固醇的摄入可能导致缺乏症
VITAMIN_B6.FACT_2: 维生素B6不会改善认知或情绪
VITAMIN_B6.FACT_3: 可能有助于缓解怀孕期间出现的轻微恶心和呕吐症状
VITAMIN_B6.FACT_4: 可能有助于抵御空气污染的有害影响
VITAMIN_B6.FACT_5: 身体不会储存维生素 B6，并会通过尿液排出多余的维生素 B6，因此人们每天都需要摄取足够的维生素 B6

VITAMIN_B7.HEAD: B7
VITAMIN_B7.NAME: 生物素
VITAMIN_B7.DESK: 生物素被称为“美容维生素”，因为它对头发、皮肤和指甲的状况有积极作用。
VITAMIN_B7.FUNC: 加速脂肪酸、葡萄糖和氨基酸产生能量的关键步骤。在组蛋白修饰、基因调控和细胞信号传导中发挥关键作用
VITAMIN_B7.DEF_1: 眼睛、鼻子、嘴巴和生殖器周围出现皮疹
VITAMIN_B7.DEF_2: 头发稀疏或脱发、皮肤或指甲问题
VITAMIN_B7.OVER_1: 即使高摄入量也不知道对人体有毒
VITAMIN_B7.FACT_1: 生物素和铬组合可能会改善血糖控制
VITAMIN_B7.FACT_3: 促进健康的头发、皮肤和指甲
VITAMIN_B7.FACT_4: 发育中的胎儿需要生物素才能健康怀孕
VITAMIN_B7.FACT_5: 一项针对 23 名进行性多发性硬化症患者的研究发现，高剂量生物素（100-600 毫克/天）与五分之五的进行性视力丧失患者的持续临床改善相关； 18名患者中有16名肢体部分瘫痪
VITAMIN_B7.FACT_6: 實驗證明，生蛋清是一種生物素拮抗劑，會導致維生素缺乏症的症狀

VITAMIN_B9.HEAD: B9
VITAMIN_B9.NAME: 叶酸
VITAMIN_B9.DESK: 它参与红细胞和白细胞的形成，帮助身体产生 DNA 和 RNA 细胞，以及将碳水化合物转化为葡萄糖。蛋白质代谢 DNA 和 RNA 的产生 从碳水化合物中获取能量 胚胎神经系统的发育 制造健康的红细胞
VITAMIN_B9.FUNC: 蛋白質代謝。 DNA 和 RNA 的生產。 從碳水化合物中獲取能量。 產生健康紅血球所需。 它對胎兒神經系統的發育有正面的影響，尤其是在懷孕初期。
VITAMIN_B9.DEF_4: 老化过程中的认知功能紊乱
VITAMIN_B9.DEF_5: 头发、指甲和皮肤的变化
VITAMIN_B9.DEF_6: 酒精会干扰叶酸的吸收并加快叶酸分解的速度
VITAMIN_B9.OVER_1: 更高的含量可以掩盖维生素 B12的 缺乏症
VITAMIN_B9.OVER_2: 叶酸毒性在进食食物时极为罕见
VITAMIN_B9.FACT_1: 叶酸与核黄素有重要的代谢相互作用
VITAMIN_B9.FACT_2: 维生素 C 可以提高叶酸的生物利用度
VITAMIN_B9.FACT_3: 富含叶酸的饮食与心血管疾病风险降低有关。 基于对 1,980 名芬兰男性进行为期 10 年的研究
VITAMIN_B9.FACT_4: 葉酸有時也稱為葉酸或葉酸。
VITAMIN_B9.FACT_5: 叶酸摄入不足可能导致基因组不稳定和染色体断裂，而这通常是癌症发展的特征
VITAMIN_B9.FACT_6: 过量补充叶酸可能会加速癌症患者的肿瘤生长（需要更多研究）

VITAMIN_B12.HEAD: B12
VITAMIN_B12.NAME: 钴胺素
VITAMIN_B12.DESK: 钴胺素负责中枢神经系统的健康。它有助于抵抗压力和抑郁。与 B9 一起帮助形成红血球
VITAMIN_B12.FUNC: 对于神经递质的合成极为重要。大脑和神经的生长、发育和功能。红细胞形成、细胞代谢和 DNA 的产生。
VITAMIN_B12.DEF_5: 缺乏症状需要数年时间才会出现
VITAMIN_B12.DEF_6: 素食主义者处于高风险中
VITAMIN_B12.OVER_1: 即使服用大剂量，维生素 B12 通常也被认为是安全的，因为身体不会储存过量
VITAMIN_B12.FACT_1: 身体储存大约 从1 到5 毫克维生素 B12 -- 是一天通常摄入量的 1,000 到 2,000 倍
VITAMIN_B12.FACT_2: 抑郁症和骨质疏松症与维生素 B12 含量低有关
VITAMIN_B12.FACT_3: 较高量的叶酸可以掩盖维生素 B12 缺乏症
VITAMIN_B12.FACT_4: 将维生素 B-12 与维生素 C 一起服用可能会减少体内维生素 B-12 的可用量。 为避免这种相互作用，请在服用维生素 B-12 补充剂两小时或更长时间后服用维生素 C
VITAMIN_B12.FACT_5: 有助于大脑功能，尤其是随着年龄的增长
VITAMIN_B12.FACT_6: 它與 B9 一起參與紅血球的形成

VITAMIN_C.HEAD: C
VITAMIN_C.NAME: 抗坏血酸
VITAMIN_C.DESK: 它可以保护细胞免于过早老化，并支持血管的功能、骨骼和软骨的状况。它对皮肤再生也很重要，因为它参与胶原蛋白的合成。强化血管壁 增强免疫系统
VITAMIN_C.FUNC: 感染和伤口愈合。强大的抗氧化剂。形成血管、健康的皮肤、软骨和肌肉。骨骼中的胶原蛋白合成。保护细胞。神经递质的产生。
VITAMIN_C.DEF_7: 吸烟者或吸二手烟的风险更高
VITAMIN_C.OVER_1: 每天超过 2000 毫克可能会促进肠胃不适和腹泻
VITAMIN_C.OVER_2: 高维生素 C 摄入量也有可能增加尿液中草酸盐和尿酸的排泄，这可能导致肾结石的形成
VITAMIN_C.OVER_3: 导致铁吸收过多并导致组织损伤。
VITAMIN_C.OVER_4: 可能会降低维生素 B12 和铜的含量
VITAMIN_C.FACT_1: 维生素 C 补充剂不能预防普通感冒
VITAMIN_C.FACT_2: 较高的维生素 C 摄入量与出现皱纹、皮肤干燥和更好的皮肤老化外观的可能性较低有关。
VITAMIN_C.FACT_3: 可以增加您对含铝药物中铝的吸收
VITAMIN_C.FACT_4: 吸烟的人比不吸烟的人每天需要多 35 毫克的维生素 C

CALCIUM.HEAD: Ca
CALCIUM.NAME: 钙
CALCIUM.DESK: 钙是骨组织的主要元素，也是细胞活动的通用调节剂。
CALCIUM.FUNC: 健康的骨骼和牙齿。在血液凝固中起重要作用。帮助肌肉收缩，调节正常的心律和神经功能。保持组织刚性、强壮和灵活。
CALCIUM.DEF_1: 可能导致骨质疏松症的骨强度降低
CALCIUM.OVER_1: 高血鈣症的症狀：腎臟、膽及膀胱形成結石、胃潰瘍（隨著酸度降低）、心臟疾病
CALCIUM.FACT_1: 人体 99% 的钙储存在骨骼中
CALCIUM.FACT_2: 一些临床试验发现补钙可以改善老年人的骨骼健康
CALCIUM.FACT_3: 单独补钙或与维生素 D 联合补钙可增加老年人的骨密度
CALCIUM.FACT_4: 增加钙的摄入量可降低老年人骨折和跌倒的风险
CALCIUM.FACT_5: 对 1,179 名 55 岁以上女性进行的为期 4 年的试验：每天单独服用 1,400 至 1,500 毫克 钙、1,400 至 1,500 毫克钙加 27.5 微克维生素 D3 或安慰剂。 与安慰剂组相比，服用联合疗法的女性癌症发病率降低 60%，服用仅钙补充剂的女性癌症发病率降低 47%
CALCIUM.FACT_6: 对 77,712 名成年人进行的为期 8 年的研究：与 587 毫克/天相比，平均钙摄入量为 1999 毫克/天可使患结肠癌的风险降低 26%。 未发现与直肠癌风险的关联

CHLORIDE.HEAD: Cl
CHLORIDE.NAME: 氯
CHLORIDE.DESK: 氯有助於胃液的合成/產生並形成良好的食慾。 保留組織中的水分，防止身體失去水分。
CHLORIDE.FUNC: 调节进出细胞的液体量和营养物类型（体液渗透压）。维持适当的酸碱平衡（pH 值）。触发消化所需的胃酸。刺激动作 神经和肌肉细胞。启动氧气和二氧化碳的流动。
CHLORIDE.FACT_1: 食盐是我们饮食中氯化物的主要来源，由 60% 的氯化物和 40% 的钠组成
CHLORIDE.FACT_2: 当您的身体流失大量水分时，就会出现缺乏症。 这可能是由于大量出汗、呕吐或腹泻。
CHLORIDE.FACT_3: 1 克食盐约含 600 毫克氯化物。 成年人对氯化物的最低需要量约为每天 700 毫克

CHROME.HEAD: Cr
CHROME.NAME: 铬合金
CHROME.DESK: 铬对正常的脂肪代谢必不可少。缺乏这种元素会导致超重和肥胖。
CHROME.FUNC: 增强激素胰岛素的作用。它还参与碳水化合物、蛋白质和脂肪的分解和吸收。
CHROME.DEF_1: 精制糖含量高的饮食会导致更多的铬从尿液中排出
CHROME.OVER_2: 肝功能障碍和肾功能衰竭
CHROME.OVER_3: 肝功能障碍和肾功能衰竭
CHROME.FACT_1: 吸收不好，最多5%被肠道吸收
CHROME.FACT_2: 维生素 C 和 B3（烟酸）可促进铬的吸收
CHROME.FACT_3: 地球上最常见的元素之一
CHROME.FACT_4: 一项小型研究表明，铬可能会降低胰岛素抵抗的风险，但研究结果并不一致
CHROME.FACT_5: 一项针对多囊卵巢综合征女性的研究表明，CR 可显着降低体重指数 (BMI) 和游离睾酮水平
CHROME.FACT_6: 补充铬对体重或血脂没有影响。 然而，一项研究表明吡啶甲酸铬可能会降低体重和体脂百分比。 需要更多的研究。
CHROME.FACT_7: 金属铬无毒，但可溶性化合物有毒（损害呼吸道、腐蚀皮肤、增加对过敏原的敏感性）

COPPER.HEAD: Cu
COPPER.NAME: 铜
COPPER.DESK: 铜参与红细胞（红细胞）的形成，是胶原蛋白的主要成分。
COPPER.FUNC: 维护血管。支持免疫系统。协助各种酶为身体产生能量。分解和吸收铁。构建红细胞、胶原蛋白、结缔组织和脑神经递质。协助正常的大脑发育和免疫功能
COPPER.OVER_1: 身体能有效排出多余的铜，过量服用很少见
COPPER.FACT_1: 我们的有机体不能产生铜
COPPER.FACT_2: 基因突变或衰老导致铜含量异常
COPPER.FACT_3: 摄入大量锌、铁或维生素 C 的人可能需要更多的铜
COPPER.FACT_5: 动物研究：口服铜可能有助于预防和减缓关节炎，但缺乏人类证据。
COPPER.FACT_6: 有一些轻微的证据表明，将铜与锌、锰和钙一起服用可能有助于减缓绝经后妇女的骨质流失速度。
COPPER.FACT_7: 人体研究发现，长期服用高浓度的锌补充剂可能会降低人体吸收铜的能力。
COPPER.FACT_8: 一项研究发现，在痴呆症患者大脑受损部位，较高的铜含量不会与酶结合。 需要更多的研究。
COPPER.FACT_9: 铜有助于将氧气输送到大脑
COPPER.FACT_10: 大脑中的铜含量是人体中含量最高的
COPPER.FACT_11: 锌和铜会相互干扰对方的吸收，因此建议在早晚等不同时间服用

IODINE.HEAD: I
IODINE.NAME: 碘
IODINE.DESK: 碘对于甲状腺的正常功能很重要。
IODINE.FUNC: 需要制造甲状腺激素，这对正常的新陈代谢、生长和发育至关重要。
IODINE.DEF_5: 甲状腺功能减退症（甲状腺激素水平低）——儿童会影响身心发育
IODINE.OVER_1: 大多数健康人通常耐受性良好
IODINE.OVER_2: 导致体重减轻、心跳加快和出汗的甲状腺功能亢进综合症
IODINE.FACT_1: 70% 到 80% 的碘存在于颈部的甲状腺中
IODINE.FACT_2: 我们的身体不能产生碘
IODINE.FACT_3: 用于消毒皮肤和清洁伤口
IODINE.FACT_4: 应在接触辐射后服用，以降低患甲状腺癌的风险
IODINE.FACT_5: 中度至重度碘缺乏症，尤其是儿童，会使智商降低约 12-13.5 分
IODINE.FACT_6: 65% 的患有纤维囊性乳腺疾病的女性接受碘治疗后疼痛减轻

IRON.HEAD: Fe
IRON.NAME: 铁
IRON.DESK: 它影响血红蛋白水平并确保氧气输送到组织。
IRON.FUNC: 维持健康的血液。支持肌肉新陈代谢和健康的结缔组织。身体生长、神经发育、细胞功能和某些激素的合成所必需的。血红蛋白的主要成分，红细胞中携带氧气的一种蛋白质 从你的肺里。
IRON.DEF_3: 混乱，注意力不集中，注意力下降
IRON.DEF_7: 怀孕期间铁摄入不足会增加女性患贫血的风险
IRON.DEF_8: 在美国，12% 的 6 至 11 个月大的婴儿缺铁
IRON.OVER_1: 多余的铁不能被人体排出体外
IRON.OVER_3: 意外过量服用含铁产品是美国 6 岁以下儿童致命中毒的主要原因
IRON.OVER_4: 1983 年至 2000 年间，至少有 43 名美国儿童死于摄入含有高剂量铁（36-443 毫克铁/公斤体重）的补充剂
IRON.OVER_5: 可能导致血色素沉着症，从而导致糖尿病、肝损伤和皮肤变色
IRON.FACT_1: 动物研究将缺铁与精神问题联系起来
IRON.FACT_2: 世界上多达 80% 的人口可能缺铁
IRON.FACT_3: 世界卫生组织：全球16.2亿例贫血病例中约有一半是由于缺铁
IRON.FACT_4: 含有 25 毫克或更多铁的补充剂会减少锌的吸收
IRON.FACT_5: 对儿童健康的大脑发育和成长很重要
IRON.FACT_6: 一些研究发现，服用铁补充剂可以改善铁含量略低的人的运动表现
IRON.FACT_7: 维生素C有助于非血红素铁的吸收
IRON.FACT_8: 钙（包括所有乳制品）、麸皮、茶和未加工的全谷物产品会阻碍铁的吸收。
IRON.FACT_9: 用铁锅烹饪食物可以显着增加你的铁
IRON.FACT_10: 您可以从食物中获取两种类型的铁：血红素和非血红素。 血红素铁更容易被人体吸收。 血红素铁的最佳饮食来源是瘦红肉、家禽、鱼、贝类（尤其是牡蛎）、肝脏和其他内脏。 非血红素铁包括干豆和豌豆、豆类、坚果和种子、全谷物、深色糖蜜和绿叶蔬菜。 一些营养素有助于身体更好地吸收这种铁。 植物和铁强化食品仅含有非血红素铁，而肉类、海鲜和家禽则同时含有血红素和非血红素铁
IRON.FACT_11: 血色素沉着症是一种由 HFE 基因突变引起的疾病，与体内铁的过度积累有关。 大约十分之一的白人携带最常见的 HFE 突变 (C282Y)，但每 1,000 人中只有 4.4 名白人是该突变的纯合子并患有血色素沉着症。 这种情况在其他种族群体中并不常见。

MAGNESIUM.HEAD: Mg
MAGNESIUM.NAME: 镁
MAGNESIUM.DESK: 这种矿物质可确保心脏正常工作。它对神经系统和肌肉以及蛋白质合成都是必需的。
MAGNESIUM.FUNC: 酶激活（超过 300）。产生能量。调节体内钙、铜、锌、钾、维生素 D 和其他重要营养素。作为电导体收缩肌肉并使心脏稳定跳动。 DNA 和 RNA 的合成。
MAGNESIUM.DEF_9: 肌肉痉挛、癫痫发作、无力和不宁腿综合征（RLS
MAGNESIUM.OVER_5: 患有肾脏疾病的人有更高的毒性风险
MAGNESIUM.OVER_6: 低血压、心跳异常、心脏病发作
MAGNESIUM.FACT_1: 肾脏限制这种矿物质的尿液排泄
MAGNESIUM.FACT_2: 美国人的饮食调查始终显示缺镁
MAGNESIUM.FACT_3: 缺镁可能是骨质疏松症的危险因素
MAGNESIUM.FACT_4: 缺镁与促进头痛的因素有关
MAGNESIUM.FACT_5: 身体的每个器官，尤其是心脏、肌肉和肾脏，都需要镁。
MAGNESIUM.FACT_6: 成人体内含有约 25 克镁，其中 60% 储存在骨骼中
MAGNESIUM.FACT_7: 镁补充剂是治疗腿脚抽筋的常用药物。 它没有得到科学证明。
MAGNESIUM.FACT_8: 食用含足够镁的饮食可以降低患高血压（高血压）的风险。 然而，证据尚无定论。
MAGNESIUM.FACT_9: 较高的饮食摄入量（高达 250 毫克/天）与较低的缺血性心脏病风险相关。 需要进行大型临床试验才能更好地理解它。
MAGNESIUM.FACT_10: 镁含量较高的饮食与患糖尿病的风险显着降低有关。 需要更多的研究。
MAGNESIUM.FACT_11: 短期研究：20 名患有骨质疏松症的绝经后妇女服用 290 毫克/天的柠檬酸镁 30 天，骨质更新受到抑制。

MANGANESE.HEAD: Mn
MANGANESE.NAME: 锰
MANGANESE.DESK: 锰影响蛋白质、碳水化合物和脂肪的新陈代谢。它还能增强胰岛素的作用，使血液中的胆固醇保持在一定水平。
MANGANESE.FUNC: 分解碳水化合物、蛋白质和胆固醇。构建骨骼并保持免疫和生殖系统平稳运行。形成结缔组织、骨骼、凝血因子和性激素。帮助钙吸收和血糖调节。
MANGANESE.DEF_8: 男性碱性磷酸酶活性增加
MANGANESE.DEF_9: 改变情绪并增加女性的经前疼痛
MANGANESE.FACT_1: 与维生素 K 一起作用，通过凝血帮助伤口愈合
MANGANESE.FACT_2: 大脑中异常的锰浓度与类似于帕金森病的神经系统疾病有关
MANGANESE.FACT_3: 锰是SOD抗氧化剂的一部分，可以保护细胞免受自由基分子的伤害

MOLYBDENUM.HEAD: Mo
MOLYBDENUM.NAME: 钼
MOLYBDENUM.DESK: 钼是许多酶的组成部分。它参与氮的同化作用，强化牙釉质，还能预防阳痿。
MOLYBDENUM.FUNC: 处理蛋白质和遗传物质，如 DNA。帮助分解药物、酒精和有毒物质。
MOLYBDENUM.FACT_1: 肾脏是钼含量的主要调节剂
MOLYBDENUM.FACT_2: 成人吸收了 40% 到 100% 的膳食钼。 婴儿几乎吸收了母乳中的所有钼
MOLYBDENUM.FACT_3: 分解嘌呤和亚硫酸盐。 亚硫酸盐是添加到某些食品中以保持颜色和保质期的防腐剂； 有些人对亚硫酸盐敏感，导致过敏反应。

PHOSPHORUS.HEAD: P
PHOSPHORUS.NAME: 磷
PHOSPHORUS.DESK: 磷對於骨骼和牙齒至關重要。 在它的幫助下，體內形成蛋白質和核酸； 它有助於吸收許多營養物質。
PHOSPHORUS.FUNC: 在身体如何储存和使用能量方面的重要作用。所有组织和细胞的生长、维护和修复。基因构建块、DNA 和 RNA 的产生。将血液 pH 值保持在正常范围内。过滤掉废物 在肾脏中。调节神经和肌肉的正常功能，包括心脏。
PHOSPHORUS.DEF_3: 骨痛、骨骼脆弱和关节僵硬
PHOSPHORUS.DEF_4: 疲劳、呼吸不规则、麻木、无力
PHOSPHORUS.DEF_5: 最常见的缺乏症原因是肾脏问题
PHOSPHORUS.DEF_6: 过度使用含铝抗酸剂会与磷结合并增加缺乏症的风险
PHOSPHORUS.DEF_7: 酒精可能会从骨骼中浸出磷并导致体内磷含量低。
PHOSPHORUS.DEF_8: 高剂量的胰岛素可能会降低血磷水平
PHOSPHORUS.OVER_2: 可能导致体内钙质沉积和软组织硬化，例如肾脏
PHOSPHORUS.OVER_3: 会干扰身体利用铁、钙、镁和锌的能力
PHOSPHORUS.OVER_4: 同时使用磷和钾补充剂可能会导致血液中钾过多
PHOSPHORUS.FACT_1: 肾脏、骨骼和肠道严格调节体内的磷含量。
PHOSPHORUS.FACT_2: 除了钙，磷是体内最丰富的矿物质
PHOSPHORUS.FACT_5: 人体 85% 的磷存在于骨骼和牙齿中
PHOSPHORUS.FACT_6: 有助于减轻锻炼后的肌肉疼痛
PHOSPHORUS.FACT_7: 一些观察性研究支持高磷酸盐水平与心血管疾病风险之间的联系。 血清磷酸盐每增加 1 mg/dL，心房颤动的风险就会增加 13%。 需要进一步研究。
PHOSPHORUS.FACT_8: 1988-1994 年收集的数据：到 2006 年，高磷摄入量（1,000+ 毫克/天）与成人全因死亡率和心血管死亡率增加有关
PHOSPHORUS.FACT_9: 饮食中钙和磷的平衡可以降低骨质疏松症（脆骨）的风险。 随着您摄入的磷量增加，对钙的需求也会增加。 当体内的磷多于钙时，身体就会使用储存在骨骼中的钙。 这会导致骨质疏松症并导致牙龈和牙齿问题。

POTASSIUM.HEAD: K
POTASSIUM.NAME: 钾
POTASSIUM.DESK: 钾是人体所有细胞和组织的主要元素。它对于神经和心血管系统的正常运作是必要的。
POTASSIUM.FUNC: 维持我们细胞内正常的液体水平。被身体的所有组织使用。帮助肌肉收缩并支持正常的血压。电解质。
POTASSIUM.DEF_6: 镁耗竭会增加钾的流失
POTASSIUM.DEF_7: 盐敏感性（钠摄入量的变化对血压的影响比正常程度更大）
POTASSIUM.OVER_5: 心率不规则，非常大的剂量会导致心脏异常和死亡
POTASSIUM.FACT_1: 大多数美国人摄入的钾含量低于推荐值
POTASSIUM.FACT_2: 它的对应物钠在细胞外维持正常的液体水平
POTASSIUM.FACT_3: 保持体内钾的适当平衡取决于血液中钠和镁的含量。 过多的钠，在使用大量盐的西方饮食中很常见，可能会增加对钾的需求
POTASSIUM.FACT_4: 老年人患高钾血症的风险更大，因为随着年龄的增长，他们的肾脏清除钾的效率降低
POTASSIUM.FACT_6: 肾脏控制钾的排泄。 肾功能正常、饮食中钾摄入量高的人不会造成健康风险，因为肾脏会消除多余的钾
POTASSIUM.FACT_7: 每天至少排出 195 毫克钾
POTASSIUM.FACT_8: 大多数临床试验表明补钾可降低血压
POTASSIUM.FACT_9: 钾含量高、钠含量低的饮食可以降低患高血压和中风的风险
POTASSIUM.FACT_10: 从以水果和蔬菜为主的饮食中摄入更多的钾可能会改善骨骼健康。 然而，还需要更多的研究
POTASSIUM.FACT_11: 许多针对成年人的观察性研究发现，低钾摄入量与空腹血糖、胰岛素抵抗和 2 型糖尿病发生率增加之间存在关联。 这些联想在黑人中可能更强
POTASSIUM.FACT_12: 由于潜在的副作用和与药物的相互作用，您应该仅在知识渊博的医疗保健提供者的监督下服用膳食补充剂。

SELENIUM.HEAD: Se
SELENIUM.NAME: 硒
SELENIUM.DESK: 它保护细胞并影响免疫系统的工作。硒抑制癌细胞的分裂并保护神经元和心肌细胞。
SELENIUM.FUNC: 构建 DNA。保护细胞免受自由基和感染的伤害。参与生殖和甲状腺激素的代谢。免疫系统的正常功能。
SELENIUM.DEF_7: 缺乏加上额外的压力可能会导致某些疾病的发展，例如克山病
SELENIUM.OVER_2: 头发和指甲脱落或变脆
SELENIUM.FACT_1: 体内的大部分硒都储存在肌肉组织中（28% 至 46%）
SELENIUM.FACT_2: 用作抗氧化剂，尤其是与维生素 E 结合使用时
SELENIUM.FACT_3: 体内硒浓度随年龄下降
SELENIUM.FACT_4: 甲状腺含有最高浓度的硒
SELENIUM.FACT_5: 研究：每天摄入 200 微克以上硒并持续 7 年以上的人患 2 型糖尿病的风险明显更高。 需要更多的研究，结果尚无定论。
SELENIUM.FACT_6: 九项随机临床试验：硒可能有助于预防胃肠道癌症，但需要更多的临床试验才能得出强有力的结论。
SELENIUM.FACT_7: FDA：一些科学证据表明，摄入硒可能会降低患某些癌症的风险。 FDA 已确定此证据是有限的且不是决定性的。
SELENIUM.FACT_8: 巴西坚果含有大量硒（每个坚果 68-91 微克），如果经常食用可能会导致硒中毒
SELENIUM.FACT_9: SU.VI.MAX 研究表明女性身体硒浓度与甲状腺体积之间存在反比关系

SODIUM.HEAD: Na
SODIUM.NAME: 钠
SODIUM.DESK: 钠对于身体维持水盐平衡、血压调节、神经和肌肉功能至关重要。
SODIUM.FUNC: 维持细胞外的正常液体水平。维持血压的主要组成部分。神经、肌肉和其他身体组织正常工作所必需的。它是一种电解质。
SODIUM.DEF_2: 头痛、意识模糊、烦躁、烦躁
SODIUM.DEF_3: 抽搐、疲劳、肌肉无力、痉挛或痉挛
SODIUM.DEF_5: 取决于体内水钠平衡。 当钠含量下降或水含量增加时，我们最终会出现钠缺乏症。
SODIUM.OVER_1: 感觉比平时更臃肿或浮肿
SODIUM.FACT_1: 钾，它的对应物，维持细胞内正常的液体水平
SODIUM.FACT_2: 目前，食物中的钠含量没有限制
SODIUM.FACT_3: 在美国，每 10 人中就有 9 人会在一生中的某个阶段患上高血压
SODIUM.FACT_4: 通常女孩的钠摄入量明显少于男孩
SODIUM.FACT_5: 将美国的平均每日钠摄入量减少到每天 2,300 毫克（约 1 茶匙盐）将预防 1,100 万例高血压
SODIUM.FACT_6: 当细胞外液体中的钠含量低于正常水平时，水就会进入细胞以平衡水平。 这会导致细胞因水过多而膨胀。 脑细胞对肿胀特别敏感，这会导致许多低钠症状
SODIUM.FACT_7: 芬兰和英国已率先成功地减少钠含量

ZINC.HEAD: Zn
ZINC.NAME: 锌
ZINC.DESK: 锌不能在人体内产生，但它对免疫系统、所有器官的稳定运作和荷尔蒙的分泌非常重要。
ZINC.FUNC: 创建 DNA、细胞生长、构建蛋白质、修复受损组织和支持健康免疫系统的主要成分。用于 100 多种酶。嗅觉/味觉的正常功能。
ZINC.OVER_5: 降低高密度脂蛋白胆固醇水平
ZINC.OVER_7: 没有关于仅从饮食中摄取过多锌的报道。 过量仅来自补充剂。
ZINC.OVER_8: 超过 50 毫克/天的剂量可能会干扰铜的吸收
ZINC.OVER_9: 超过 142 毫克/天的剂量可能会破坏镁平衡
ZINC.FACT_2: 锌还与味觉和嗅觉有关
ZINC.FACT_4: 在医学上用于治疗伤口
ZINC.FACT_6: 大多数锌储存在骨骼肌和骨骼中
ZINC.FACT_7: 锌可以减轻感冒症状的严重程度和持续时间
ZINC.FACT_8: 因为它有助于细胞生长和繁殖，所以在儿童、青春期和怀孕等快速生长时期需要充足的锌。
ZINC.FACT_9: 人类视网膜的锌浓度很高，研究表明，同时含有锌和抗氧化剂的补充剂可能会延缓 AMD（年龄相关性黄斑变性）的进展
ZINC.FACT_10: 研究人员假设锌耗竭可能在糖尿病进展中发挥作用。 迄今为止的证据不足以支持任何结论
ZINC.FACT_11: 锌和铜会相互干扰对方的吸收，因此建议在早晚等不同时间服用

WAIST.HEAD: 腰围
WAIST.ICO: 最佳腰围围度追踪 Apple Watch 应用程序的图标。与 与苹果健康同步 完全同步。无需广告、付款和注册即可轻松使用。
WAIST.TEXT: 在 Apple Watch 上追踪腰围的最简单方法。 所有记录都会同步到您的Apple健康状况。
WAIST.IMG: 直接从手臂追踪腰围大小（腹部按钮）
WAIST.DWN: 从 Apple App Store 下载免费的腰身应用程序
WAIST.ABOUT: 易于使用的Apple Watch腰围追踪器。 不需要帐户或注册。 完全免费。 所有记录都已同步到您的 与苹果健康同步 应用程序，过去7天可以直接从手腕访问。
WAIST.DESC1: 如果更多的脂肪位于您的腰部而不是臀部周围，则您患心脏病和2型糖尿病的风险更高。
WAIST.DESC2: 研究表明，与广泛使用的体重指数相比，测量腰围可能是更好的预测心脏病风险的方法。
WAIST.DESC3: 当您增加肌肉而失去几英寸的脂肪时，您的体重可能不会有太大变化。 这就是为什么身体成分可以告诉您的不仅仅是规模，还可以告诉您真实的故事。
WAIST.DESC4_3: 腰围每5厘米增加，男性，女性的风险分别为17％和13％

ZINC.HEAD: 锌
ZINC.ICO: 我们免费的 Apple Watch 应用程序图标，可帮助您跟踪锌的消耗量。从您的 Apple Watch 记录饮食中的锌，并与 与苹果健康同步 同步。无需配套 iPhone 应用程序即可运行。零广告。
ZINC.TEXT: 简约的机身锌质追踪器为您的手表带来美丽。 启用了 与苹果健康同步。 实际结果。 自由。 零个广告。
ZINC.IMG: 跟踪您的日常消费锌补充剂
ZINC.DWN: 从Apple Store免费获得FeedZinc应用程序
ZINC.ABOUT: 易于使用饮食锌跟踪器为Apple Watch。 与与苹果健康同步自动同步，不需要注册和完全免费。
ZINC.DESC1: 锌可能会显着降低您的年龄相关疾病的风险，例如肺炎，感染和与年龄相关的黄斑变性（AMD）。 它可以通过促进T细胞和天然杀伤细胞的活性来缓解氧化应激并改善免疫应答，这有助于保护您的身体免受感染。 补充锌经验的老年人改善了流感疫苗接种反应，降低了肺炎的风险，提高了心理表现。
ZINC.DESC2: 锌通常用于医院作为烧伤的治疗，某些溃疡和其他皮肤受伤。 事实上，您的皮肤持有相对较高的量 - 您的身体锌含量约为5％。
ZINC.DESC3: 降低氧化应激并减少身体中某些炎症蛋白的水平。 氧化应激导致慢性炎症，各种慢性疾病的贡献因素，如心脏病，癌症和精神衰退。

SIZE.HEAD: 身材
SIZE.SUBHEAD: 美丽的身体。 由您打造！
SIZE.ICO: App Store 上适用于 Apple Watch、iPhone、iPad 和 Mac M 计算机的最佳体型追踪器图标。 Body Size 让您了解自己，帮助您保持体形。测量值会自动同步到 Health Mate 应用程序，这意味着您可以使用易于阅读的图表直观显示结果。零广告。
SIZE.TEXT: 在手表上追踪臀部，腰部和胸部。全面支持与苹果健康同步。快速加载时间。完全免费。
SIZE.IMG: 使用手腕上的手表测量胸部尺寸，胸围宽度，腰围和臀部长度
SIZE.DWN: 直接从Apple App Store获取Apple Watch的免费体型应用程序
SIZE.ABOUT: 在 Apple Watch 上追踪您的臀部、腰部和胸部。 使用 Bradley Bayou 公式自动计算体型。 全面支持苹果健康。 iCloud 备份。 加载时间快。 绝对免费。
SIZE.DESC1: 当你获得肌肉和失去英寸的脂肪时，你的体重可能不会变化。 这就是为什么身体构成可以告诉你超过规模，它告诉你真实的故事。
SIZE.DESC2: 为什么衡量？ 我们不知道任何医疗或健康需求。 然而，胸部（胸围）宽度是完美身体比例最重要的测量之一。 据信正确的比例比身体的整体尺寸或高度更具吸引力。
SIZE.DESC4: 证据表明，大腿和背面周围的脂肪比腰部周围的脂肪更难以偏移。 腰部与臀部比通常用作健康的指标或衡量标准，以及发展严重健康状况的风险。
SIZE.DESC5: 你的体型是苹果型还是梨型？ 或者也许是一个沙漏？ 找出您的真实体型不仅仅是这些毫无意义的在线测试之一。 了解您的体型可能会帮助您发现最有效的锻炼方式。 研究表明，它可以帮助改善您的健康。

EMOTION.HEAD: 情感
EMOTION.ICO: 最快速、全球最知名的心理测试图标。有机会了解并预测您的情绪。只需选择8种您喜欢和不喜欢的颜色。免费，无广告。
EMOTION.TEXT: 情绪突然波动？情感变化剧烈？仅需1分钟找出根本原因。
EMOTION.IMG: 世界上最快的个性测试。选择8种颜色，了解您当前的心理状态。
EMOTION.DWN: 免费获取适用于Apple Watch、iPhone或iPad的应用程序，直接从Apple App Store下载
EMOTION.ABOUT_1: 压力、焦虑、抑郁或情绪波动？
EMOTION.ABOUT_2: 在一分钟内揭示您情绪的根本原因。
EMOTION.DESK1: 一言以蔽之 - 简单。它非常简单。与其他测试不同，情感直接与您的潜意识一起工作。无需回答100个令人厌烦的问题。只需让您的潜意识以最愉悦的顺序选择颜色。
EMOTION.ALT1: 用颜色确定个人内在状态的最快心理测试的图像

LIST1.LI1_TEXT: 可视化一段时间内焦虑水平、情感平衡、能量等因素的变化
LIST1.LI2_TEXT: 测试结果方便地组织并在您所有设备上访问
LIST1.LI3_TEXT: 找出您的抑郁、焦虑、失眠、记忆力不佳、注意力不集中等问题的根本原因

BIORHYTHMS.HEAD: Biorhythms
BIORHYTHMS.IMG: Track your biorhythms with our apps
BIORHYTHMS.DWN: Get our free Emotion app for Apple Watch, iPhone or iPad directly from the Apple App Store and start tracking your biorhythms easier.
BIORHYTHMS.DESK1_1: Biological rhythms are fluctuations in the functional parameters of the human body relative to the conditional zero level. All biological rhythms originate from the date of birth of a person, which is a common zero point for them, and fluctuate in the form of sinusoidal waves throughout life.
BIORHYTHMS.DESK1_2: The most important rhythms are physical, emotional and intellectual, they have the strongest influence on the state of the body. It should be noted that for each person the level of influence of biological rhythms is very individual, depending on the lifestyle.
BIORHYTHMS.DESK2: When any of the rhythms is at the highest point, the actions we do are more successful, and vice versa for the low points of the rhythm. Each of the 3 rhythms is divided into 5 phases that follow each other.
BIORHYTHMS.ALT2: An image that shows the fluctuations in physical, emotional and intellectual biorhythms, which are even easier to track with Martspec applications

LIST2.LI1_TEXT: The phase is at its maximum. This is the best time for activities, complex tasks, decision making and new beginnings.
LIST2.LI2_TEXT: You feel an increase in confidence, concentration and energy. This is the time to learn or improve your skills.
LIST2.LI3_TEXT: A critical day for the human body. If possible, it is better to refrain from doing anything.
LIST2.LI4_TEXT: Your thoughts are slowing down and your performance is deteriorating, and it's getting harder and harder to hold back.
LIST2.LI5_TEXT: All your actions negatively affect you, you have apathy, aggression, irritability.

BIORHYTHMS.DESK3_1: The purpose of tracking biorhythmic cycles is to be able to calculate critical days to avoid various activities.
BIORHYTHMS.DESK3_3: The critical day (zero day) occurs when the time intervals cross the zero line. At this moment, the transition from one phase of the biorhythmic cycle to another takes place. There are three critical days in each cycle, these days are accompanied by unstable states, internal processes change. It is advisable to exercise caution these days.
BIORHYTHMS.ALT3: Image for human biological rhythm charts that are easy to track with Martspec applications
BIORHYTHMS.HEAD4: Why is it necessary to monitor biorhythms?
BIORHYTHMS.DESK4: Biological rhythm disturbances can affect a person's health and well-being. Some of the effects include:
BIORHYTHMS.ALT4_1: Icon for poor performance that can be alerted with biorhythm tracking
BIORHYTHMS.ALT4_2: Icon for daytime sleepiness due to human biological rhythm disorder
BIORHYTHMS.ALT4_3: Icon for a state of anxiety that can be more easily tracked by monitoring one's own biological rhythms
BIORHYTHMS.ALT4_4: Icon for lack of appetite caused by differences between biological rhythms in the human body

LIST4.LI1_TEXT: Significantly reduced mental activity, thinking, memory impairment.
LIST4.LI2_TEXT: Biological rhythm disturbance causes sleep disorders such as insomnia.
LIST4.LI3_TEXT: Decrease in the protective functions of the psyche due to frequent psycho-traumatic situations.
LIST4.LI4_TEXT: The difference in the rhythms of the body leads to a decrease in appetite, deterioration in well-being and diseases.

BIORHYTHMS.HEAD5: Tracking biological rhythms just got easier
BIORHYTHMS.DESK5: Keep track of your health, mood swings and physical activity with our apps
BIORHYTHMS.ALT5: A picture of the Emotion app that makes it easier to track fluctuations in your biological rhythms

PHYS.HEAD: Physical Rhythm
PHYS.DESK: The physical biological rhythm is responsible for the physical condition of a person, the state of his endurance, muscle and, most importantly, heart strength, and endurance is the ability to withstand stress. The cycle consists of 23 days. In a positive period, the physical tone of the body increases, and in a negative - decreases.

EMOT.HEAD: Emotional Rhythm
EMOT.DESK: The emotional biological rhythm is responsible for the body's ability to create and experience emotions. The cycle consists of 28 days. During the period of a positive emotional biological rhythm, a person feels more inspired. In the negative zone of the biological rhythm, people often experience a crisis of creativity and sensitivity, may fall into depression.

INTEL.HEAD: Intelligent Rhythm
INTEL.DESK: The intellectual biological rhythm determines the state of a person's mental activity, his ability to remember a variety of information, study science, learn, draw conclusions, consists of 33 days. Accordingly, in the positive part of this biological rhythm, such abilities are increased, and in the negative part they are reduced.

ANXIETY.HEAD: Anxiety
ANXIETY.IMG: Track your Anxiety with our apps
ANXIETY.DWN: Get our free Emotion app for Apple Watch, iPhone or iPad directly from the Apple App Store and start tracking your anxiety easier.
ANXIETY.DESK1_1: Anxiety is an emotion characterized by feelings of tension, fear, worry, and even horror. This can make you sweat, feel anxious and tense, and have a racing heart. Anxiety can give you energy or help you focus. But for people with anxiety disorders, fear is not temporary and can be overwhelming.
ANXIETY.DESK1_2: Fear is an emotional response to an immediate threat and is more associated with the fight or flight response - either staying to fight or leaving to avoid the danger.
ANXIETY.DESK1_3: Anxiety disorder is a condition that develops gradually after a period of excessive worry; symptoms may vary in intensity and persist for longer periods of time. Anxiety disorders can cause people to avoid situations that trigger or worsen their symptoms. It can affect work productivity, schoolwork and personal relationships.
ANXIETY.DESK2: The average age of onset of an anxiety disorder is 20–24 years. They can occur with other mental disorders such as depression or post-traumatic stress disorder. There are several types of anxiety disorders, including:

LIST2.LI1_TEXT: People with GAD worry about common issues such as health, money, work, and family. It often occurs along with other anxiety disorders or depression, and occurs almost every day for several months.
LIST2.LI2_TEXT: People with panic disorder experience panic attacks. These are sudden, repeated periods of intense fear when there is no danger. The attacks occur quickly and can last several minutes or more.
LIST2.LI3_TEXT: People with phobias experience intense fear of something that poses little or no real danger. Their fear may be related to spiders, flying, going to crowded places or social situations.

ANXIETY.ALT2: An image that shows the Anxiety, which are even easier to track with Martspec applications
ANXIETY.DESK3: Anxiety disorders have many symptoms. Each disorder has different symptoms. Symptoms common to anxiety disorders generally include:

LIST3.LI2_TEXT: Feelings of impending danger, panic, or doom
LIST3.LI6_TEXT: Trouble concentrating or thinking about anything other than the present concern
LIST3.LI9_TEXT: Sweaty or cold hands and/or feet

ANXIETY.DESK4: The causes of anxiety disorders are currently unknown but likely involve a combination of factors, including genetic, environmental, psychological and developmental. Some factors that have been involved include:

LIST4.LI1_TEXT: Severe or prolonged stress can contribute to changes in the chemical balance in the brain.
LIST4.LI2_TEXT: Stressful or traumatic events can also contribute to feelings of anxiety.
LIST4.LI3_TEXT: Having close family members with symptoms of an anxiety disorder increases the risk that a person will also develop an anxiety disorder
LIST4.LI4_TEXT: Certain genes may predispose a person to be more likely to develop an anxiety disorder.
LIST4.LI5_TEXT: Some underlying medical conditions can contribute to anxiety. Some of these include chronic pain, heart disease, diabetes, thyroid problems, respiratory disease, drug use and drug withdrawal.
LIST4.LI6_TEXT: Recently, more and more people are paying attention to the connection between diet and anxiety. Factors such as GMOs, gluten and pesticides that are present in processed foods can have a negative impact on the health of our gut and microbial colonies. A probiotic supplement high in bifidobacteria may be beneficial in maintaining a healthy composition of intestinal flora.

ANXIETY.ALT4: An image that shows the Anxiety, which are even easier to track with Martspec applications
ANXIETY.DESK5_1: In today's world, anxiety has become a common problem that can seriously affect a person's quality of life and psychological well-being. However, thanks to advancements in technology, we can turn to mobile apps like Emotion and other innovative solutions to diagnose and even help treat anxiety.
ANXIETY.DESK5_2: The Emotion mobile app offers a convenient and accessible way to assess your anxiety level and receive recommendations on how to manage it. The application provides the ability to track your emotional states and analyze factors that cause anxiety.
ANXIETY.DESK5_3: Treating anxiety is a complex process that may include psychotherapy, pharmacological therapy, and lifestyle changes. Although each anxiety disorder has unique characteristics, most respond well to two types of treatment: psychotherapy or “talk therapy” and medication. Cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT), a type of talk therapy, can help a person learn different ways of thinking, reacting and behaving to reduce anxiety. Medications will not cure anxiety disorders, but they can significantly relieve symptoms. The most commonly used medications are anti-anxiety medications and antidepressants.
ANXIETY.DESK5_4: Mobile apps can be effective tools for self-management of anxiety in the early stages, but it is always recommended to seek professional advice and support from a qualified professional.
ANXIETY.DESK5_5: In general, the use of mobile applications is a promising direction in diagnosing anxiety. They help people better understand their emotional state, learn to manage anxiety, and improve their quality of life.

PRODUCTIVITY.HEAD: 生產力
PRODUCTIVITY.DWN: 直接從 Apple App Store 取得適用於 Apple Watch、iPhone 或 iPad 的免費情緒應用程式。
PRODUCTIVITY.DESK1_1: 生產力是商業中經常使用的術語，儘管事實上它可以適用於生活的所有領域。 個人生產力是指一個人完成任務或實現目標的一致性和有效性。
PRODUCTIVITY.DESK1_2: 時間管理是一套有助於有效運用個人時間的技能和工具。 然而，「生產力」一詞源自於「產品」一詞，因此將產品本身置於關注的中心。 時間和資源是次要的。
PRODUCTIVITY.DESK2: 一個有生產力的人是一個能夠持續有效地管理自己的時間、資源和努力以實現有意義的目標和結果的人。 高效的人以能夠在不犧牲品質的情況下高效完成任務的能力而聞名。 以下是高效人士的一些關鍵特徵和習慣：

LIST2.LI1_TEXT: 有效率的人會設定明確的目標和優先事項。 他們清楚自己想要實現什麼，並且有目的地努力實現這些目標。
LIST2.LI2_TEXT: 他們珍惜時間並明智地利用它。 有效率的人會優先考慮任務，為重要活動分配時間，並避免浪費時間的活動。
LIST2.LI3_TEXT: 他們專注於自己的任務，避免分心和同時處理多項任務。 這有助於他們更有效率、更好地完成任務。
LIST2.LI4_TEXT: 他們確定影響最大的任務，並優先於較不重要的活動。 這可確保首先完成高優先級任務。
LIST2.LI5_TEXT: 高效率的溝通清晰簡潔，避免不必要的對話。 這可以最大限度地減少誤解並節省時間。
LIST2.LI6_TEXT: 他們願意學習新技能並提高知識。 這種適應性思維有助於他們在快節奏的世界中保持高效率。
LIST2.LI7_TEXT: 他們知道自己的極限，並且在自己的任務已經滿的情況下，不害怕拒絕額外的任務或責任。
LIST2.LI8_TEXT: 生產力並不以犧牲個人福祉為代價。 他們認識到平衡的重要性，並騰出時間放鬆、培養興趣愛好以及與親人共度時光。

PRODUCTIVITY.DESK3_1: 了解生產力和績效之間的差異非常重要。 績效是指在一定時間內完成的工作量，而生產力則旨在在同一時期內取得更好的成果。
PRODUCTIVITY.DESK3_2: 當我們談論更快更好地工作時，它與性能的提高有關。 它涉及在給定的時間內完成更多的任務，這需要有效的時間管理和分配工作時間的能力。
PRODUCTIVITY.DESK3_3: 另一方面，生產力是在工作時交付更好的結果的重點。 這意味著透過開發新技能或更有效的方法來不斷努力提高工作品質。
PRODUCTIVITY.DESK3_4: 實現高生產力和生產力的關鍵因素不僅是任務的速度或一段時間內完成的工作量，而且還包括品質水準。 這個問題可以透過適當的規劃、時間管理以及不斷發展技能和知識來解決。
PRODUCTIVITY.DESK4_1: 有生產力的人擁有一套寶貴的技能和習慣，可以大大提高他們的生活品質。 由於能夠有效解決問題，他們所承受的壓力較小，這種平靜也延伸到了他們的人際關係中，促進了與親人之間更深層的聯繫。 他們的重點是成功的心態往往會帶來職業發展，因為他們因其貢獻和持續高品質的工作而受到重視。
PRODUCTIVITY.DESK4_2: 生產力的影響超越了個人成就，因為生產力高的人往往是高效率的員工和團隊成員。 他們的組織方法和按時完成任務的能力使他們在團隊工作中成為寶貴的資產。 此外，他們對個人成長和自我完善的渴望會激勵他人，並創造一種持續學習和發展的文化。
PRODUCTIVITY.DESK4_3: 從本質上講，高效的人更有能力抓住機會、體驗個人滿足感並積極影響他人。 他們將自己的努力與目標相協調的能力有助於他們的生活充滿成就、滿足感和有意義的連結。
PRODUCTIVITY.DESK5_1: 提高生產力不是一朝一夕的事。 雖然這對某些人來說似乎很容易，但他們有效規劃和利用時間的能力往往與既定的習慣有關，這些習慣會隨著時間的推移提高生產力。 為了提高工作效率，請專注於以下關鍵策略：

LIST5.LI1_TEXT: 確定具體的、可實現的目標來引導你的努力。
LIST5.LI2_TEXT: 確定高影響力的任務並首先解決它們。
LIST5.LI3_TEXT: 創造一個專注的工作空間並限制干擾。
LIST5.LI4_TEXT: 使用待辦事項清單、行事曆和工具進行有效的規劃。
LIST5.LI5_TEXT: 將任務分解為更小的、可管理的步驟以保持動力。
LIST5.LI6_TEXT: 只要有可能，將任務委派給其他人以騰出您的時間。
LIST5.LI7_TEXT: 使用應用程式和工具來簡化任務和溝通。

PRODUCTIVITY.DESK5_2: 如果您想提高工作效率，請嘗試模仿這些規則。 對於任何想要充分利用時間的人來說，目標導向、組織、專注、自我照顧和分散注意力的技能都是一項重要的技能。
PRODUCTIVITY.HEAD6: 富有生產力的人的職業
PRODUCTIVITY.DESK6_1: 高效的人可以透過有效的時間管理、目標導向的思維和對成果的關注，在廣泛的職業生涯中取得成功。 然而，在選擇職業時，考慮個人的優勢、興趣和價值觀很重要。 以下是一些高效人士可以取得成功的職業範例：
PRODUCTIVITY.DESK6_2: 生產力特徵可能不相同的職業:
PRODUCTIVITY.DESK6_3: 請記住，關鍵是要在適合您自然傾向的職業和充滿挑戰和興奮的職業之間找到平衡。 雖然有些職業似乎更適合高效人士，但個人熱情、持續學習和適應能力可以在許多領域帶來成功。

HARMONY.HEAD: Harmony
HARMONY.DWN: Get the free Emotion app for Apple Watch, iPhone or iPad right from the Apple App Store».
HARMONY.DESK1_1: Internal harmony, often referred to as inner peace or emotional balance, is a state of well-being where your thoughts, emotions, and actions are in agreement. It entails a sense of calm, satisfaction, and absence of internal conflict. Achieving internal harmony can lead to better internal balance, improved mental health, and a more fulfilling life.
HARMONY.DESK1_2: Harmony is the alignment of four elements: what we say, what we think, what we feel, and what we do. When there is agreement, alignment, and congruence between our thoughts, feelings, actions, and words, we experience an internal and external sense of peace called harmony. In psychology, harmony denotes a positive state of inner calm, balance, and a sense of oneness with the world.
HARMONY.HEAD2: Why do you need internal harmony?
HARMONY.DESK2: When a person is in agreement with himself, when his thoughts, words, deeds and feelings are synchronized, he does not need to look for the guilty, cling, find fault, criticize and judge strictly. When a person is in agreement with himself, he can not pay attention to the shortcomings, mistakes, imperfections and “shortcomings” of others. Inner harmony is essential for your overall well-being and mental health. This may lead to:
HARMONY.DESK3: Internal harmony implies a state of being where you experience a sense of calm, satisfaction, and absence of internal conflict. Harmony encompasses the following characteristics:

LIST3.LI2_TEXT: You accept yourself and your emotions without judgment.
LIST3.LI3_TEXT: You tend to view situations with optimism and hope.
LIST3.LI4_TEXT: You adapt well to changes and unexpected challenges.
LIST3.LI5_TEXT: Your mind is relatively free from excessive worry and rumination.

HARMONY.DESK4: Harmony is a choice that you can consciously make. It is a mental state, not a physical environment in which you are situated. You can attain and sustain your internal harmony simply by adopting the appropriate attitude towards life. Here are a few steps that can help you achieve internal harmony:

LIST4.LI1_TEXT: Understand your emotions, triggers, and thought patterns. Recognize when you are losing balance or experiencing inner turmoil. Self-awareness is the first step towards finding equilibrium.
LIST4.LI2_TEXT: Accept yourself, your emotions, and your experiences without judgment. Embrace both positive and negative feelings as part of the human experience. Accept your flaws and imperfections as part of what makes you unique.
LIST4.LI3_TEXT: Release attachment to past regrets and future anxieties. Focus on the present moment and detach from things that are beyond your control.
LIST4.LI4_TEXT: Replace negative self-talk with positive affirmations and compassionate self-dialogue. Treat yourself with the same kindness and understanding as you would a friend.
LIST4.LI5_TEXT: Set clear boundaries to protect your emotional well-being. Learn to say 'no' when necessary and prioritize activities and relationships that positively impact your life.
LIST4.LI6_TEXT: Regularly express gratitude for the positive aspects of your life. This practice can redirect your attention from negativity and enhance your sense of satisfaction.
LIST4.LI7_TEXT: Maintain a healthy lifestyle through proper nutrition, regular physical exercise, and adequate sleep. Physical well-being has a significant impact on your emotional balance.
LIST4.LI8_TEXT: Reach out to friends, family, or a mental health professional when needed. Talking about your feelings and problems can bring clarity and alleviate emotional burden.

HARMONY.DESK5: Remember, achieving internal harmony is an ongoing journey, and it's natural to experience fluctuations in your emotional state. Be patient with yourself and celebrate small victories along the way. Incorporating these practices into your daily life can gradually lead to a greater sense of inner peace and well-being.

INDEPENDENCE.HEAD: Independence
INDEPENDENCE.DWN: Get the free Emotion app for Apple Watch, iPhone or iPad directly from the Apple App Store.
INDEPENDENCE.DESK1_1: Independence is a personality trait in which a person consistently prefers to act on one's own thoughts and feelings rather than listen to the opinions of others. This means that you do not rely on others to achieve your goals and face life's challenges head-on face.
INDEPENDENCE.DESK1_2: Independent personality types tend to be very confident and resourceful, and they often have a strong sense of independence. They can also be considered stubborn and headstrong, and they usually prefer to take charge rather than follow someone else's lead.
INDEPENDENCE.DESK1_3: Independent personality types are often very successful in fields that require creative thinking or problem solving, as they are not afraid to think outside the box. However, they may also have difficulty working in a team, as they may resist authority figures.

LIST2.LI1_TEXT: It involves making decisions about one's personal life, such as career, lifestyle and relationship choices, without the need for constant scrutiny or input from others.
LIST2.LI2_TEXT: People with intellectual independence can form their own opinions, beliefs and viewpoints based on their research and analysis, rather than accepting ideas unquestioningly.
LIST2.LI3_TEXT: Financially independent people have the ability to manage their finances, make investment decisions, and fulfill financial responsibilities without relying on others.
LIST2.LI4_TEXT: Emotionally independent people can manage their emotions, strive for personal growth, and find inner satisfaction rather than relying on others for emotional support.
LIST2.LI5_TEXT: This refers to the ability to work autonomously, take initiative, and make decisions in a professional context without constant supervision.

INDEPENDENCE.DESK3: Here are some of the most common characteristics of the independent personality type:

LIST3.LI1_TEXT: Independent people have the ability to make decisions based on their own beliefs, values ​​and preferences.
LIST3.LI2_TEXT: They have strong critical thinking skills, which allows them to analyze situations objectively.
LIST3.LI3_TEXT: Independence often goes hand in hand with intrinsic motivation.
LIST3.LI4_TEXT: People who face problems head-on and find creative solutions without relying solely on others.
LIST3.LI5_TEXT: Independent people tend to be more confident because they have experience making their own decisions and achieving success.

INDEPENDENCE.HEAD4: How can you tell if you have an independent personality type?
INDEPENDENCE.DESK4_1: Determining whether you are an independent personality type involves self-awareness, introspection and consideration of your behavior, preferences and tendencies. They often prefer to make decisions based on their own judgment and values, solving problems on their own without seeking help
INDEPENDENCE.DESK4_2: They tend to be confident and assertive, have a strong sense of self, and often express their unique points of view. Prefer to be in control of their lives and tasks. They are less likely to succumb to peer pressure or societal expectations if they conflict your own beliefs and desires. Independent personality types also tend to actively seek opportunities for self-improvement and personal growth, often implementing them on their own.
INDEPENDENCE.DESK4_3: Remember that personality traits exist on a wide spectrum, and no one is completely independent or completely dependent on others. People can exhibit different degrees of independence in different areas of their lives and depending on the context. Additionally, having an independent type personality doesn't mean you should avoid collaboration or teamwork; rather, it's about finding the balance that works best for you.
INDEPENDENCE.HEAD5: Problems of an independent personality type
INDEPENDENCE.DESK5_1: While having an independent personality can be beneficial in many ways, it is important to understand that there can also be problems and potential problems with this trait. Here are some problems that people with a strong independent personality type may face:

LIST5.LI1_TEXT: The tendency to rely solely on one's own perspective and decisions can lead to stubbornness. This can make it difficult to accept alternative points of view or adapt to changing circumstances.
LIST5.LI2_TEXT: A highly independent person may have difficulty collaborating effectively in a group. They may resist compromise or struggle with giving up control.
LIST5.LI3_TEXT: Independent people can set high standards for themselves and strive for excellence. This can lead to undue stress and frustration when things don't go as planned.
LIST5.LI4_TEXT: Those with strong independence may resist authority figures or rules that they feel limit their autonomy.
LIST5.LI5_TEXT: Unwillingness to receive feedback from others can hinder personal growth and improvement. Constructive criticism should be avoided, depriving the opportunity for self-development.
LIST5.LI6_TEXT: Strongly independent people may have difficulty forming deep emotional connections in relationships due to a fear of relying on others. This can affect both friendships and romantic partnerships.
LIST5.LI7_TEXT: Failure to rely on others or seek cooperation may result in lost valuable opportunities that require teamwork or collective effort.

INDEPENDENCE.DESK5_2: It is important to note that these problems are not common to all people with an independent personality type. Many of these problems can be mitigated through self-awareness, active efforts to develop emotional intelligence and communication skills, and a willingness to find a healthy balance between independence and cooperation.
INDEPENDENCE.DESK6_1: Independence as a personality trait reflects a person's ability and tendency to think and act autonomously without relying heavily on external influences for guidance or confirmation. Independent people tend to make decisions based on their own beliefs, values, and judgments rather than on conforming to social norms or seeking constant approval. This trait is often associated with self-confidence, critical thinking and a strong sense of individuality. Suitable for such people:

LIST6.LI3_TEXT: Creative professions: art, music and design.

INDEPENDENCE.DESK6_2: It is important to note that while independence can contribute to success in these fields, collaboration and effective communication skills are also valuable in most professions. Finding a balance between independence and teamwork is essential to a fulfilling career path. Additionally, people are unique , and their career path may be influenced by a combination of traits and interests other than independence.

ENERGY.HEAD: Energy
ENERGY.DWN: Get the free Emotion app for Apple Watch, iPhone or iPad directly from the Apple App Store.
ENERGY.DESK1_1: People with high Energy scores are active, lively and enthusiastic. They are sociable, competitive, cheerful and open. They are more comfortable communicating with strangers, visiting new places and starting new things. People with low Energy scores are quieter, reserved and withdrawn. They tend to conserve energy, accumulate strength and have an attitude towards minimizing effort, and are not ready for active activity.
ENERGY.DESK1_2: Energy can refer to a person's level of enthusiasm and vitality. Although not traditionally considered a distinct personality trait, a person's energy level can greatly influence their behavior, interactions, and overall approach to life.
ENERGY.DESK1_3: It is important to note that higher energy levels indicate greater activation of the sympathetic nervous system and metabolic processes. However, if this level is too high for a long time, it can lead to detrimental stress reactions.
ENERGY.DESK2: An energetic person exhibits unique characteristics that influence his lifestyle and interaction with the world around him. Such a person has unique characteristics such as vitality, sociability and adaptability. It is these traits that help him experience a fulfilling life, achieve success in various fields of activity and build quality relationships with people around you.

LIST2.LI1_TEXT: - allows a person to be distinguished from other people by his high energy and activity. It manifests itself in the desire to achieve goals and complete assigned tasks. An energetic person is full of enthusiasm, passion and determination to overcome challenges along the way. Thanks to this characteristic, he is able turn every challenge into a new opportunity for growth and development. Typically, people with high vitality are quite easy to identify in the workplace by their physical energy, alertness and excitement. When it comes to work, they enjoy change and variety, and will seek out situations who offer them. People with low scores are calmer, more deliberate, and more deliberate about their actions. For some people, their style may indicate a lack of motivation or enthusiasm. But this is not necessarily the case. They simply do not show their excitement in the same way and do not like be the center of attention.
LIST2.LI2_TEXT: is another wonderful feature of an energetic person. Such people gravitate toward communication, they find joy and inspiration in contact with other people. They easily make new acquaintances, actively participate in group events and are not afraid to speak in front of an audience. This sociability allows them to make strong connections, build a support network, and gain new opportunities. People with high scores are the “social butterflies” of your company, known throughout all departments. They like to be involved in what is happening around them. They quickly connect with people , making them invaluable assistants. Those with low scores are more secretive and reserved. They are slower to join new teams and may feel uncomfortable in social situations. Others may take longer to get to know them and may have Fewer close relationships.
LIST2.LI3_TEXT: People with high scores are curious and inquisitive. They are able to easily adapt to new situations and quickly respond to changes in the environment. This allows them to solve problems effectively and quickly adapt to new demands and challenges. When faced with a problem, they love seek the opinions of others and find it inspiring to share ideas in a group. On the other hand, people with low scores prefer to work on a problem alone and present their findings after careful thought and consideration.

ENERGY.DESK3: Energetic people are characterized by high levels of enthusiasm, energy, and vitality. They exude a sense of liveliness and are often considered dynamic and attractive. Here's how energy can manifest itself as a personality trait:

LIST3.LI1_TEXT: Personalities with high energy levels are often characterized by enthusiasm, liveliness and active participation in various activities. They exude positivity and radiate vitality in their interactions. Energetic people tend to be outgoing, enjoy socializing and can be the life of the party. They oftenapproach challenges with determination and readily embrace new experiences. Their energy can be contagious and inspiring to others.
LIST3.LI2_TEXT: People with moderate energy levels find a balance between high and low energy states. They can adapt their energy levels to different situations, showing enthusiasm when necessary, as well as appreciating moments of calm. People with average energy can enjoy communication, but also appreciate silence and reflection. They are often able to maintain a steady pace of work without becoming overtired.
LIST3.LI3_TEXT: People with lower energy levels tend to be more reserved and withdrawn. They find rejuvenation in solitude and may take longer to recuperate. While they may not display high levels of enthusiasm, they often have a deep ability to focus, introspect, and reflectively. People with low energy levels can be very productive and engage in tasks that align with their interests and values.

ENERGY.DESK4_1: Energetic people bring dynamism and vibrancy to various aspects of life. They thrive on social media, inspire and often excel in leadership positions. However, maintaining a balance between their enthusiasm and self-care is critical to avoid burnout and maintain long-term well-being. Benefits of energetic people:

LIST4_1.LI1_TEXT: Energetic people inspire and motivate others with their enthusiasm and positivity.
LIST4_1.LI2_TEXT: Their dynamic personality often leads to natural leadership roles and the ability to rally people around common goals.
LIST4_1.LI3_TEXT: Their quick thinking and willingness to embrace change make them adaptable in different situations.
LIST4_1.LI4_TEXT: Energetic people can create extensive networks due to their outgoing nature.

ENERGY.DESK4_2: It is important to note that energy levels can vary depending on factors such as physical health, sleep quality, mental well-being and individual characteristics. People may also demonstrate different energy levels in different contexts or at different points in their lives. Disadvantages energetic people:

LIST4_2.LI1_TEXT: Continuously high energy levels can lead to burnout if not balanced with rest and self-care.
LIST4_2.LI2_TEXT: excess energy can lead to impulsive decisions without sufficient thought.
LIST4_2.LI3_TEXT: Energetic people may take on too many tasks and responsibilities, which leads to stress.
LIST4_2.LI4_TEXT: The need to maintain high energy levels may arise from seeking validation from others.

ENERGY.DESK5_1: Energetic people thrive in activities that allow them to express their vitality and interact with others. Some suitable activities may include team sports, dancing, outdoor adventures such as hiking or cycling, networking events , public speaking, and high-energy creative pursuits such as acting or speaking. Here are some career interests that might appeal to energetic people:
ENERGY.DESK5_2: Energetic people should consider their strengths, interests and values when choosing career options. It is important to find a career path that matches their natural qualities, but also leaves room for personal growth and well-being.

OPENNESS.HEAD: Openness
OPENNESS.DWN: Get the free Emotion app for Apple Watch, iPhone or iPad directly from the Apple App Store.
OPENNESS.DESK1_1: Openness is a general appreciation of art, emotion, adventure, unusual ideas, imagination, curiosity and diversity of experience. An open person is someone who can share directly their thoughts and feelings, hopes and fantasies. Such a person can speak, what he doesn't like and what he likes, admit love and hate, fear, resentment and all other feelings, express his point of view. He does not hide (opens) what is inside him and is open to everything new that comes from the outside.
OPENNESS.DESK1_2: Open people, compared to closed people, are usually more sociable, effective in communication and influence, and inclined toward support and other positive forms of interaction.
OPENNESS.DESK2_1: Openness to experience is a broad personality dimension that reflects traits associated with curiosity, imagination, artistic interests, preference for novelty, and tolerance for ambiguity. Openness to experience, or simply openness, is one of the five domains of the Big Five personality trait taxonomy.
OPENNESS.DESK2_2: These people exhibit high levels of curiosity, they enjoy new experiences, constant learning, and they tend to be original due to their «thinking outside the box» mentality. People low in openness to experience prefer routine, familiarity, and the traditional or conventional ways. They are less creative and inventive and prefer concrete to abstract thinking.
OPENNESS.DESK3: Openness to experience represents both the willingness to try something new and the ability to implement abstract and complex ideas. Analyzing this personality trait, some people may be very creative, curious and willing to try new experiences, while others may be more consistent and cautious. Common traits associated with high openness to the value of experience include:

LIST3.LI1_TEXT: - The most common term that comes to your mind is «outside the box thinking». People who are open to finding creative ideas within themselves and bringing them to life are highly creative by nature. Those who weak imagination, prefer facts and logic to fantasy.
LIST3.LI2_TEXT: - if you enjoy art of all kinds, find detail and perfection in everything you do and in everyday life you rely on both imagination and intuition.
LIST3.LI3_TEXT: - Finding emotional balance. High emotionality means you are aware of your thoughts and feelings and can find composure in stressful situations.
LIST3.LI4_TEXT: - take risks, be bold and accept whatever the outcome of the decision you make. Someone high in this trait has a well-rounded approach to life and experiences excitement when doing something unusual and outside the usual routine.
LIST3.LI5_TEXT: - solve problems and look at abstract reality with curiosity and intrigue. Those who score high tend to be more philosophical and intelligent, especially when it comes to unique concepts.
LIST3.LI6_TEXT: - associated with liberalism in the choice of rules. High liberalism tendencies mean that they think they are above the rules and get high grades because they are willing to put forward their thoughts and express their opinions.

OPENNESS.DESK4_1: Openness is a quality that can influence not only a person's psychology, but also his genetics and upbringing. There are several reasons why openness is an important aspect of our lives.
OPENNESS.DESK4_2: In psychology, openness means a willingness to try new things, explore, and share information. People with high levels of openness tend to be more creative, innovative, and able to adapt to change. They also show a greater willingness to self-reflect and develop as individuals.
OPENNESS.DESK4_3: Genetics also play a role in determining a person's level of openness. Some studies have shown that certain genes may be associated with this trait. This means that some people may be more open-minded by the nature of their DNA.
OPENNESS.DESK4_4: Parenting can also influence a person's level of openness. Parents who encourage their children's interests in new experiences, learning and development, can contribute to the development of openness in them.
OPENNESS.DESK4_5: Twin studies of the Big Five personality traits suggest that heritability accounts for 40% to 60% of individual variance in traits. While there is not much research on the specific causes of each individual trait, one study found that 21% of the variance  openness between people is due to heredity. Another study found that approximately 10% of the variance in novelty seeking is due to genetic inheritance.
OPENNESS.DESK4_6: In general, openness plays an important role in our lives. It helps us adapt to change, be creative and develop as individuals. Psychology, genetics and upbringing all have an impact on a person's level of openness.
OPENNESS.DESK5_1: Openness to experience also predicts patterns of career interests or preferences for specific types of jobs or work environments. For example, in a meta-analysis of samples, researchers at Iowa State University found that openness consistently predicted stronger artistic and research interests and weaker traditional ones interests.
OPENNESS.DESK5_2: These results indicate that highly open-minded people gravitate toward careers that require working with abstract ideas, creativity, design, open-ended exploration, and unstructured environments. While there is a wide range of careers that fit this description, few examples of highly artistic careers , high research and low traditional interests include:
OPENNESS.DESK5_3: Conversely, lower openness to experience predicts the opposite pattern of interests: higher conventional and lower artistic and exploratory interests. These careers are more likely to have a highly structured environment and require adherence to clearly defined rules and procedures. Examples of such professions include:
OPENNESS.DESK6_1: Openness is usually measured using questionnaires or tests. They contain multiple statements and people select the answer that best reflects how much they agree or disagree with the statement. Statements can take the form of agreeing with specific adjectives or statements about themselves
OPENNESS.DESK6_2: However, there is an easier way to find out your Openness - the Emotion application, which works directly with your subconscious. In one minute you will find out not only the level of your openness, but many other emotional characteristics, and you will be able to decide in which direction it is better to act
OPENNESS.DESK6_3: Very open people describe themselves with words such as intelligent, deep, complex, creative and introspective. In contrast, less open people are more likely to use words such as «simple», «predictable», «traditional» «traditional» and «old-fashioned». Informants (such as friends and relatives) use similar adjectives to describe more or less open people.
OPENNESS.DESK6_4: A person who scores high on Openness to Experience is likely to enjoy learning, is interested in the arts, and enjoys meeting new people. A person who scores low on this factor prefers routine and tradition and likes to focus on factual or logical ideas They may enjoy accounting because it is a field that involves numbers and rules that are relatively clear to follow.

MISSION.HEAD: 使命
MISSION.M: 我们让每个人都能快速轻松地跟踪他们的健康状况。
MISSION.P1: 我们的使命要求我们尽一切可能扩大人的潜力。 我们通过遵循三个基本概念来做到这一点：
MISSION.P1_1: 创造突破性的技术创新
MISSION.P1_2: 让我们的应用程序更具启发性和美丽
MISSION.P2: 为了实现我们的雄心壮志，我们从科学开始。 已发表的科学研究和分析在增强功能的开发中发挥着重要作用。 与我们的用户一起，我们正在寻找更有效地跟踪、衡量和应用健康的方法。 反馈是开启未来创新的重要工具，包括创建新应用、改进现有应用，甚至淘汰不造福于人们的应用。

ABOUT.HEAD: 关于我们
ABOUT.P1: 市場規範 成立於 二千零二十 年春天。那段時間，許多人在家工作，日常生活習慣發生變化，導致許多人停止定期鍛煉。這導致他們的身體和健康發生重大變化。
ABOUT.P2: 我們的健康應用程序經過專門設計，旨在為用戶提供培養健康習慣的工具。通過仔細跟踪他們的進展，每天都會有效地提醒人們他們對健康的堅定不移的奉獻，這最終導致他們的整體福祉的實質性改善。
ABOUT.P3: 與那些不每天監控自己健康的人相比，每天監控自己的健康狀況的人往往會取得更大的進步。
ABOUT.P4: 我們堅信創意的力量可以改變態度、生活，並最終改變世界。我們的第一個想法是創建一個直接從可穿戴設備跟踪體重的應用程序。我們為 Apple Watch 開發了 体重 應用程序，讓體重追踪變得簡單，並自動在 蘋果健康 中記錄測量結果。該應用程序乾淨簡約的設計使其非常受歡迎。
ABOUT.P5: 我們最新的應用程序之一，情緒，旨在通過提供快速、簡單的性格測試來促進心理健康。除了身體健康和健康跟踪之外，我們還創建了第一個應用程序 情緒，以促進心理健康。自創建以來，該產品僅收到正面評價，並且幾乎只有 五 星級評級。
ABOUT.P6: 我們的應用程序採用尖端技術構建，並在全球提供多種語言版本。然而，這些都不重要。這不僅僅是應用程序和行業領先軟件的數量。 市場規範 是關於人的。 市場規範 是對賦予個人健康和保健能力的技術的信任。
